title: Pasty
summary: A pasty (/ˈpæsti/[1]) is a British baked pastry, a traditional variety of which is particularly associated with Cornwall, United Kingdom.[2][3] It is made by placing an uncooked filling, typically meat and vegetables, on one half of a flat shortcrust pastry circle, folding the pastry in half to wrap the filling in a semicircle and crimping the curved edge to form a seal before baking.
